snippet: Tunisia’s government has granted a license to the hard-line Islamist group Hizb al-Tahrir to allow it to become a legal political party, making it the second such group to join the political mainstream after renouncing violence.
abstract: Tunisia’s government grants a license to the hard-line Islamist group Hizb al-Tahrir to allow it to become a legal political party, making it the second such group to join the political mainstream after renouncing violence.
lead_paragraph: Tunisia’s government has granted a license to the hard-line Islamist group Hizb al-Tahrir to allow it to become a legal political party, making it the second such group to join the political mainstream after renouncing violence.
